data.title: Gretna man charged in the shooting murder of Pittsylvania County man
data.meta_description: A Gretna man is facing a murder charge after the fatal shooting of a Pittsylvania County man on Thursday, according to officials.
data.text:
A Gretna man is facing a murder charge after the fatal shooting of a Pittsylvania County man on Thursday, according to officials.

On May 30, Pittsylvania County Sheriff's Office deputies were dispatched to the 1600 block of Shula Drive in Hurt for a reported shooting incident.

Upon arrival, deputies said they found a man suffering from what appeared to be a gunshot wound. Medical aid was rendered to the lone victim, but the victim died at the scene, deputies said. The victim was identified as Jimmy Hardwick by officials.

RELATED:

Officials learned that a person of interest fled the scene before they had arrived, but a search of the crime scene area resulted in the arrest of a man.

On Friday morning, PCSO identified the suspect in the shooting as 50-year-oldBarry David Davis.

According to Davis' arrest warrant, a witness called 911 and said that they were driving and Davis and Hardwick were in the backseat. The documents state that the witness heard a gunshot and stopped the car. They said that's when Davis got out, put a gun in his pocket, and ran off.

Deputies later found Davis in the woods with blood on his clothes and shoes.

SEE ALSO:

The sheriff's office said he is charged with second-degree murder for Hardwick's death. He is also facing the following charges:

Reckless Handling of Firearms.

Use or Display of Firearm in Committing Felony.

Possession of Firearm by Felon.

Shooting From or In a Motor Vehicle as to Endanger Persons.

PCSO said he is being held in the Pittsylvania County jail without bond. Deputies said Gretna Police Department officers helped in the investigation.
